noun.description: Microscopy. An instrument which illuminates an object so that it can be more easily viewed with a microscope, comprising a glass globe filled with brine for concentrating light from a lamp, a convex lens being used to focus this light on the object. Now historical.
A telescope incorporating an image intensifier, allowing use in dark conditions. rare.

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in Samuel Pepys (1633–1703), naval official and diarist. From scoto- + -scope.
